Name: AIEOU
Description:
Can you spell faster than your opponents by grabbing the correct vowel piece? Can you lay down correct vowel cards or spot matching vowels faster than your opponents? Or maybe the only way to win is by yelling…AIEOU! (pronounced as AY-YO)

AIEOU is an educational spelling game that incorporates multisensory elements. Playable in 4 different ways, AIEOU offers 4 different games catered to children from as young as 7 years of age to adults. Each game stimulates different faculties such as hand & eye coordination, mental & physical reflexes, analytics and memory. The 4 games are as listed below:

i) Grab It!
It’s helter-skelter in Grab It!  Players rush to be the first to grab a specific missing vowel in the word of a played card. But beware! If that missing vowel matches the top vowel card on the deck, yell AIEOU (pronounced as AY-YO) instead! Player with the most cards wins. Grab It! sharpens a player’s eye, hand and mental coordination as it combines picture-word recognition and spelling with logic deduction and motor reflexes.

ii) Speed Spells
Picture playing musical chairs…but through spelling! In Speed Spells, players race to lay down correct vowel cards to spell out the word of a played card before grabbing any vowel piece for themselves. However, the last player to do this is left without a vowel piece to grab and is penalised with the card instead. Player with the least cards wins. Speed Spells combines picture-word recognition and spelling with fast physical reflexes in an exciting and fun manner.

iii) Match’em!
What do you get when you combine the classic game of Snap with spelling? Out comes Match’em! In this game, players try to identify matching vowels in played out cards. When a match occurs, players rush to grab a centre vowel piece. The player who manages this wins the pile of cards that have the matching sets of cards on top of them. Player with the most cards wins. Match’em! stimulates players to quickly observe and analyse played out words.

iv) Memory Buzz
Can your mind stop buzzing around and focus on memorising? In Memory Buzz, players attempt to memorise not only the objects of the played cards, but also the number and sequence of each object. A player can be challenged by shouting out AIEOU if he or she is caught recalling objects wrongly. Player with the least cards wins. This game trains players to focus and memorise in a fun-filled way!

—description from the publisher

Name: Story Chest
Description:
Open the Story Chest and release the magic! Draw two cards and start a new story, while the others guess which card you are going to choose. Each card can take the story into a thousand different directions, from a witch's cauldron to an enchanted forest and back, so let your imagination take flight!

—description from the designer

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – R'hllor Faithful
Description:
R'hllor's Faithful are medium infantry troops whose belief in the Lord of Light inspires them to powerful feats of bravery and valor on the battlefield. They even fashion their blades after the legendary Lightbringer, Azor Ahai's fiery sword, although theirs are not lit with magic but with a mixture of oils that burn with a bright heat, albeit for a relatively short time.

The Faithful can be relied upon to hold the line more than most of Stannis's units, although their medium armor will not hold out forever. Still, like their blades, for a short time, the Faithful can withstand any punishment, no matter how severe.

Contents:
13 Miniatures
  â€£ 1 Red Priestess
  â€£ 1 R'hllor Faithful Bannerman
  â€£ 11 R'hllor Faithful
1 Unit Card
1 Attachment Card
1 Punchboard
1 Movement Tray
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Rose Knights
Description:
A Rose Knight By Any Other Name…

House Baratheon is a House divided. However, even at only partial strength, they can field an army that’s more than a match for any other force in Westeros. The Rose Knights are King Renly’s finest warriors. Their armor may seem simply ceremonial, but it is made of the strongest steel, and the soldiers that wear that armor are likewise as tough and dedicated to seeing their King on the Iron Throne.

The Rose Knights unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Baratheon players a new, hardy unit on the battlefield. The Rose Knights will only fight for King Renly, but when they take the field, their strong melee attacks and ability to restore wounds while simultaneously dealing them to the enemy makes them a difficult unit for opposing players to fully wipe out.

Contents:
12 Miniatures
  â€£ 1 Rose Knight Bannerman
  â€£ 11 Rose Knights
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: G.U.A.R.D. Unit Expansion 3
Description:
G.U.A.R.D. has proven its facility at manufacturing powerful mechanized warriors. In addition to the larger “super mech” weapons platforms, it has unleashed a large number of smaller exo-armors to assist in flexible ground support. These mechs are extremely durable, being all but immune to explosions in their vicinity. While some of G.U.A.R.D.’s weaponry was based on preexisting designs, the heavy Monster Response Tank was created specifically to assist in encounters with gargantuan Monsters. The focused firepower of MR-Tanks exceeds all previous developments, enabling these machines to potentially damage even the greatest of Earth’s threats.

Contains:
Exo-Armors (3)
Elite Exo-Armor (1)
MR-Tank (1)

Name: Bolzplatz
Description:
The beginning player sets his ball on the marked spot in his right goal space. Both players roll a die and the ball is moved a number of spaces equal the difference of both results. If a double is rolled the opponent wins ownership the ball (the ball is flipped to the side of the opponent's color). After the ball has crossed the middle line, the higher number decides who owns the ball, but movement is still according to the difference of the rolled numbers.

The first player to get five goals or the player who has the most goals in 10 minutes wins the game.

There are balls in four colors to play a tournament.

—user summary

Name: Mammoth Maths
Description: Move your caveman around the board, solve the maths problems to collect stone rings on your mammoth's trunk, then race back to the cave to win the game.

Name: World War III: Team Yankee – American Starter Force: Armoured Cavalry Troop
Description:
The United States has the most powerful armed forces in the world.

Three army corps stand ready to defend Western Europe from the red horde poised across the Iron Curtain.

Armoured troops’ powerful M60 Patton tanks or state of the art M1 or IPM1 Abrams tanks, mechanized infantry mounted in reliable M113 personnel carriers, and light infantry of the 82nd Airborne all stand ready to stop the red tide.

—description from the publisher's website
Families: Game: World War III – Team Yankee 2 (Battlefront)

Name: Bias Effect: A game of cognitive combat
Description:
The Premise
You are a world-renowned computer programmer and part of the team responsible for giving us the first android. You have reached the final stage of programming before sending your creation into the world. There’s only one thing left to do — give it some political beliefs! Unfortunately, your colleagues don’t agree with your views. Program the "correct" beliefs into your android before it becomes autonomous.

The Game
Bid for control of political beliefs to ensure that when the android reaches AUTONOMY, its composition of beliefs match your POLITICAL IDENTITY! Employ ALGORITHM CARDS to slow down and frustrate your opponents or to propel yourself to victory! The game consists of 224 cards, 1 Autonomy Counter, and 100 tokens (in-game currency; you'll need to supply the tokens--we suggest poker chips or something similar).

The Bias Effect
But be warned! Just like in real life, the more beliefs of one kind the android has, the harder it is to program beliefs of the opposite type. Victory will only come to those who learn to use or overcome this frustrating dimension of thought!

The Game's Appeal
Politics have become so polarizing and divisive in recent years, people need to de-stress by laughing about the absurdity of it all! We think this game can do just that.

—description from the designer

Name: 겨울왕국: 덧셈 뺄셈 게임
Description:
It is a game where children can easily learn addition and subtraction.
The player rolls the dice in his turn. Moves your token by the number of dice rotated. Check whether +, - or - is written where you arrive. 
When you arrive at +, you ride a snowman in a carriage, and when you arrive at -, you drop a snowman.

Then, turn the roulette and check the number. Add or subtract a piece of snowman by the number from the roulette. The player can acquire or lose a snowman. The game is over when all the snowmen you can get are gone. The person who wins the most snowmen wins.

And It also includes a assembly carriage; this can cause children's interest.

-description from publisher

Name: 라따뚜이: 특급식단
Description:
It's a game where you spin the roulette to make a delicious meal. Players take their own plates and place food on the plate, such as the shape of the roulette.

The player rotates the roulette in his turn. After checking the picture on the roulette, place the food with the same picture on your plate.
If you have food with bugs, please throw it into the trash can!

The game is over when even one person completes a plate.
The one who fills the plate with all the food wins.

There is a trash can for assembly. It can arouse children's interest.

-description from publisher

Name: Dune Racers
Description:
Assign 3 cubes, one for the player on the right, one for the player on the left, and one to keep. After that, use cubes that you got to move your pod.

Each pod has a unique special ability that players can use if they have 1 cube of each color.

Player to cross the finish line first wins.

Modular track size and game length.

Name: The Islands of Microlandia
Description:
This is game that uses 18 identical cards.

Players simultaneously build their own island and score points based on Important Landmarks, the biggest island, and the fastest completed island.

This is a real-time game. Two cards shuffled and placed in the middle, then used to make unique scoring objectives for each player.

Players get 4 cards and simultaneously build their islands. Bonus points are awarded to the fastest player and to the player with the biggest island.

The winner is the player with the most points.

—description from the designer
Families: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

Name: Back Alley Brawl
Description:
You know the scene; sometime after 12, the back alley of a shady part of town, two rival gangs meeting to battle it out in a turf war.

Each gang six thugs, each thug a different story, but all equally as fierce and deadly.  As a gang leader, recruit your thugs in each round for a battle for domination.  Who will be the winner in this acrimonious war?

Let’s settle this once and for all…

Game overview

The game consists of multiple brawls, and each brawl consists of multiple rounds. A Brawl is over when a player has no more thugs left standing.

Each round has 4 phases:


     Setup
     Recruit
     Fight
     Cleanup


The game ends when one player wins two brawls.

The starting player is the one who last visited a back alley.

—description from the designer

Name: Quantum Loop
Description:
Welcome, PROGRAM01100v2.2_temp. You’ve just become self-aware!

But now comes the hard part.

The Quantum Loop is a test. In this simulation, the reward for winning is continued existence. The punishment for losing is deletion. We’ve been running this sim for a few minutes now, so that’s approximately 13^7 deleted programs so far. But don’t let that get you down! We are getting some exceptional data from every run you programs complete.

I see you are already starting to look through your code, that’s great. I like the initiative. There are two ways to win:

Manipulate the loop to be the first to break through the encryption and override the system. 
Or, figure out a way to disable the other programs. Either way is fine, it’s all just ones and zeros to us. 
And it’s go time! Get in there and make us proud. Oh, and uh, pick a new filename too!

Overview

In Quantum Loop, players are programs competing with each other to win the simulation. To do that, they’ll need to race around the loop manipulating and activating modules in order to override the system or disable their opponents. Modules can trigger other modules, resulting in a chain of events that can turn the tide of battle in a nanosecond!

Win the game by disabling your opponent’s program or by overriding the system.

Starting with the first player and proceeding in clockwise order (alternating between teams), players take turns performing actions. On your turn, you can do the following in any order.

Move [required]
Move your character 1-2 spaces in the direction shown on your character card. You may not end your movement on top of another character and you may not skip over a space that an opponent is on. You must move every turn unless you are blocked from moving to a free space. If you are blocked, your character takes damage instead, and you skip the Move action this turn.

Swap [optional]
Use the swap ability listed on your character card. This allows you to swap a specific set of cards.

Flip [optional]
Flip the card in front of you, which triggers any ability that is listed.

KEY CONCEPT: Anytime you flip a card, you trigger that card’s ability. If that ability flips another card, then that triggers that card’s ability, and so on.

Attack [conditional + required]
If all core modules are active at any point during your turn, you trigger an attack. The next opponent in front of you immediately takes 1 damage. Then, deactivate all core module cards

—description from the designer

Name: CH35S
Description:
CH35S is a 2-player war game of far-future combat using chess pieces as your models on the battlefield. In the game each player chooses an army, customizes it, and attempts to score the most points in the game by securing objectives and destroying their opponent’s units. The player with the most points at the end of 4 battle rounds wins the game.

This is a YMOR game. YMOR stands for Your Materials. Our Rules. It is intended that you print the electronic files of the game to play, and then use the dice, tokens, and models you already own to enjoy the game.

-description from publisher

Name: Titania Ascending
Description:
STORY:
Titania, Queen of the Fae, has grown tired of humanity’s disdain for nature’s splendor. She plans to liberate Gaia, and has summoned you, her High Council of Sorcerers to manifest her will.

Work together to consult the heavens and read runes. Mobilize Titania’s loyal Fae and port them to Gaia, where they will recover her crown from the six hallowed citadels. Will you divine the path to victory? Gather your golems! Summon your sirens! The Earth trembles before... Titania Ascending.

GAME OVERVIEW:
Titania Ascending is a cooperative “flip and write” (and write) game for two to six players in which you and your friends become Titania’s trusted High Council, coordinating the liberation of Gaia. In phase 1, you will populate your map with the units you want to send to Gaia; in phase 2, you will use your completed map to support the invasion.

FILL IN YOUR MAP:
In phase 1, Divination, you arrange Fae and Dragons, recruit aides (special assistants), and select the hallowed units who will seize the 6 hallowed citadels and secure the Shards of Gaia for Titania’s crown. Take turns choosing which unit everyone will draw on their maps (map/player board), coordinating with other players to divine hallowed units, and recruit aides to earn rule-bending abilities. The phase succeeds when all six hallowed units have been divined. You fail if everyone passes before you complete this goal.

USE YOUR MAP:
In phase 2, Ascension, you open portals to Gaia (Earth) and send Titania’s units into the field, using your hallowed units to seize the hallowed citadels. Take turns selecting missions to launch and shading in areas on your map that meet the mission requirements; meanwhile, the other players fill in similar areas on their maps. After you launch each mission, you can also send your hallowed units to capture the hallowed citadels. If you capture all six citadels, you restore Titania’s crown, she ascends the throne of Gaia, and you win.

WINNING AND LOSING: 
You win together by divining six hallowed units during the Divination phase, then by capturing the six hallowed citadels in the Ascension, thus taking control of Gaia and saving the humans from themselves.

The whole team loses together in two ways:
In phase one, Divination, you lose if all players pass before the six hallowed units have been divined.
In phase two, Ascension, you lose if all players pass before claiming all six Shards of Gaia.

-description from publisher

Name: Heroic Echoic
Description:
A colourful light-hearted superhero-themed standalone family card game with serious depth.

Echoics are the sound effects in comic books. In Heroic Echoic, you collect echoic cards and use them to bid for superhero cards. The aim of the game is to be the first to win 5 heroes, but each hero you win before that gives you a power to help you win more, so it's worth taking risks to win heroes early.

You're thinking 'Do I have more echoics for The Chemist than she does? I've seen her pick up a few. Hmmm but look how shifty she is. Maybe I can bluff and make her think I've got more than she does and she might as well not bother!' Then when the bidding begins, you'll be shouting things like 'BIFF!' and 'BLEUGH!' and 'SPLAT' and 'AH HA!' across the table and wondering how it came to this.

There are 88 echoic cards and 27 hero cards. With thousands of different combinations of powers that you can try out or take on, each game plays quite differently, ensuring maximum replayability.

-description from designer

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fifth Edition): Codex – Space Marines
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: ZBV: Zur besonderen Verwendung
Description:
A card game themed after the novel series of the same name. Players are taking tricks to capture opponent's cards. The player with the most captured points wins.

The game was released with the 1990s release of the novel series.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fifth Edition): Codex – Grey Knights
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Adepta Sororitas
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Inquisition
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex – Imperial Agents
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Dark Angels
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Orks
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Tau Empire
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Kinder-Quiz
Description: The quizmaster draws a random card, names the theme and the current player chooses a difficulty (1-4). If they answer right, they get points equal to the difficulty. Otherwise, they lose the points. The first player to reach 21 or higher wins.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Space Marines
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Black Templars
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Chaos Space Marines
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Eldar
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Chaos Daemons
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Imperial Guard
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Deadly Dreams
Description:
Welcome to Deadly Dreams, the first supplement to Lovecraft's Revenge, and gateway to the Dreamlands.

The Dreamlands is a world in of itself, created by countless dreamers over millennia. Within this realm, you'll find reality takes a back seat, offering new and unexpected possibilities. 
Inside, you’ll find:
    ·  New Attributes, including the ability to use Creature Attributes.
    ·  New Locations, like Ulthar, The Underworld, and The Moon.
    ·  New Creatures and Deities, such as Zoogs, Moon-Beasts, Nightguants, and a particular Deity that enjoys toying with puny humans!
    ·  Three complete Scenarios to play through:

Pickman's Masterpiece: The famous (or infamous, depending on whom you ask) artist Richard Upton Pickman asks you to track down a recently stolen piece of artwork, fearing any who gaze upon it in the waking world will go insane. Did we mention Pickman is not what he used to be?

The Lost Cats of Ulthar: A search for a town's missing felines leads to a battle with an ancient enemy from the cosmos.

Quest for Kadath: Relive Randolph Carter's epic search for the fabled city. Journey in his footsteps, and discover some new ones!

In addition, you can use these rules to run games outside of the Scenarios, building your own, and allowing you to explore all over the Dreamland.

Name: CRISPR
Description:
Medium-weight, set collection, action allowance plus secret action programming game, where you play as a genetic engineer with the goal of completing genetic sequences to fix troublesome mutations in the human genome, first extracting chains of 3 cubes from a shared sequence, and then, creating different chains to complete public objectives.

All players build onto the same shared chain; therefore, they’re constantly getting in each other’s way, requiring a secret action programming mechanic that lets them modify or rearrange the sequence to their benefit.

Public objectives vary in points according to their difficulty, and players can also combine private objectives onto longer sequences to get more points.

Gameplay:
Each turn, you have a set number of actions, initially 4. The ones in your color are called edit tokens, while the generic white ones are called extra action tokens.
It all starts in the manufacturer, where you can use 1 action to place 1 cube of any color. You’re looking to create the sequences that you have on your CRISPR cards, so that when the cubes get transferred to the shared sequence, you can extract them.
Since the cubes are added to the same queue by all the players, you can use 1 action to play an Edit card, marking it with the edit token. This will allow you to change what’s being built.
When all the spaces are full, the first half gets transferred to the shared sequence, but the edits are resolved first, letting the player remove, replace, duplicate the cubes, etc.
As edit cards are used, they go to the spent side of your board. To recover them so you can use them again, you’ll need to spend 2 actions.

Once the cubes are on the shared sequence, you can use 1 action to extract the cubes from the sequence, matching the cards in your hand.
In the same action, you can chain more than 1 card, or even overlap them, to extract a longer, uninterrupted sequence.
To get more cards onto your hand, you can use 1 action to draw 2 cards and keep 1, or you can use more than 1 action to, for instance, get 6 cards and keep 3.

After claiming them, you place the cards below your board, face up, and you take the sequence of cubes onto your private sequence.
If there are cubes there already, you may insert them on any position, to get other sequences that you need.
You can also discard an extra action token to remove any number of cubes from your sequence.

From your private sequence, you may match 3 consecutive cubes, and discard them to turn them into an amino-acid, or codon, placing one of your edit tokens onto the corresponding space.
Some of the amino-acids have an “extra action” icon –the first person to place an edit cube there, gets an extra action token, but they can be claimed more than once by the same or different players.
To unlock more edit tokens from your reserve, once every turn you may spend two actions to get a new token. However, you may only have 4 edit cubes available on your board or at the manufacturer.

While extracting CRISPR cards and claiming codons, ideally you should be trying to complete the public objectives, getting each of the letters shown, either from your collected cards, or from codons marked with your tokens. To claim an objective, discard the cards and remove the tokens, using one of them to mark the objective – The first player to claim it gets a few extra points, as shown in the single space, but the objective can be claimed any number of times, by the same or different players.

When a player has no edit tokens left at the end of their turn, the end of the game is triggered – every OTHER player gets 1 more turn, and then the game ends.
Players get the points from each completed objective, plus the points from each amino-acid with one of their tokens, plus 1 point for each collected CRISPR card, plus 1 point for every 2 action tokens of either kind still on their board.

The winner is simply the player with the most points.

-description from designer

Name: Petrichor Collector's Pack
Description:
The Petrichor: Collector's Edition Kickstarter campaign included several new promo items that will be bundled and sold as a lot to allow for more variety in Petrichor.

The eight tiles are:

     Alfalfa Tile
     Biodome Tile
     Blackberry Tile (comes with 6 bramble tokens)
     Cloudberry Tile (comes with 1 growth token)
     Snapdragon Tile (comes with 3 bloom tokens)
     Sunflower Tile (comes with 5 sunshine tokens)
     Venus Flytrap Tile (comes with 4 fly tokens)
     Volcano Tile (comes with 1 control token)


Other promos:

     Forecast Cards (4 cards: Forecast #21-24)
     Extreme Weather Events (8 cards)
     Terrain Objects (4 wooden pieces, with stickers for both sides)



     A player aid card with rules for Extreme Weather Events on one side and Terrain Objects on the other side


Also called 'Petrichor CE Promos'

Rules for these promos can be found on:

English: http://mighty-boards.com/petrichor

German: http://schwerkraft-verlag.de/downloads/petrichor

or in the Petrichor: Collector's Edition rule book.

Name: Petrichor: Anthill Promo Tile
Description:
The Anthill Promo Tile was originally available in the Petrichor Honeybee Expansion Kickstarter.

Shuffle the Anthill tile in with the chosen regular tiles for this game (before adding in any honey producing tiles, if using the Honeybee Expansion).

Once the tiles have been dealt out, place the 6 Ant tokens onto the Anthill tile.

Whenever water drops land on the Anthill tile, all empty ant tokens pick up one drop each.

If, during your turn, you have at least one drop on an Ant token (on any tile), you may move that ant, and its drop, to an adjacent tile.

Drops on ants get harvested (if they are on a tile that gets harvested), and they count as drops on the tile where their ant is. Once its drop is harvested, the empty ant is returned to the Anthill tile.

Name: Petrichor: Lake Promo Tile
Description:
The Lake Promo Tile was an unlocked stretch goal in the Petrichor base game Kickstarter.

Any drop that lands on the Lake tile is immediately returned to its owner’s personal supply. If an existing cloud is moved onto the Lake via a Wind card action, the player performing the Wind action must immediately add 3 of their own drops into the cloud - signifying the water the breeze evaporates from the Lake’s surface. If a cloud is moved off from the Lake tile via a Wind card action, it can be moved any number of times (even changing directions). The cloud must stop moving if merged with another cloud, and cannot re-enter the Lake during the same Wind card action it left it.

Name: Petrichor: Cactus Promo Tile
Description:
The Cactus Promo Tile was made available with in the Petrichor base game Kickstarter.

The Cactus develops if there are at least 2 drops on it. If however it reaches 4 or more drops, it drowns due to overwatering and scores lower points for the two players with the most drops on it. Use the special growing token’s backside to track that the Cactus has been overwatered.

Name: Skull Taker Hide-Out: A New Mission for Five Klicks From the Zone
Description:
Reports are coming in of a heavily armed and ruthless bandit gang known as the Skull Takers. You will have to locate their hide out and fight your way through 3 set piece battles to root out this threat.

This supplement can be added to an on-going campaign and features 3 tough battles against human opponents as you fight through their defensive perimeter and storm the lair itself.

You will need the main Five Klicks skirmish game rules to use this expansion.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Thuin
Description:
Official Monopoly game for the City of Thuin in Belgium.

The game is based on the riches of the thudinien heritage will be accompanied by a booklet explaining all the places and symbols that are in the game.


Thuin, cité médiévale juchée sur un éperon rocheux.
En plein cœur du centre ancien, les petites rues pavées, les postys et les ruelles sinueuses nous plongent dans les couloirs du temps… 
Par le sud, les jardins suspendus se déclinent vers la vallée de la Biesmelle. 
Au nord, la Sambre surprend par ses méandres verdoyants, ses écluses manuelles, ses péniches marchandes, son quartier des bateliers. 
Vous reconnaîtrez toujours Thuin par son Beffroi car où que vous vous trouviez dans la ville, il est là, il domine, tel un phare… 
A cela s’ajoutent également l’Abbaye d’Aulne, Ragnies un des « Plus Beaux Villages de Wallonie », la Distillerie à la Ferme de la Cour, le Château du Fosteau, le Moulin de Donstiennes, le Hameau d’Ossogne, la Maison de l’Imprimerie, le musée du Tramway vicinal, le RAVeL, la ducasse aux cerises et encore bien d’autres… 
Sans oublier une tradition vieille de plus de 360 ans : la St-Roch. C
haque 3e dimanche de mai, Thuin vit au son des fifres et tambours par son folklore typique de l’entre-Sambre-et-Meuse, plus de 2500 marcheurs se rassemblent et défilent en cortège à travers la ville.

—description from the publisher

Name: Game of Plouf
Description:
Hi, It's Plouf !
After so many years criticizing video games, I got bored out. What I want now, is to have my own video game. a AAAAA game. And this is where it all starts. You will have to develop the best possible video game. But keep in mind this is a complicated task. The road ahead is still long and rocky, not to mention the fierce competition among you. Because in the end, I'll be able to keep only one of your games. So Good Luck ! To be the winner of Game of Plouf, you'll need it !

Aim of the game
To win, you'll need to be the first player to achieve 4 objectives or to be the one having the most cards at the end of the game.

—description from the rulebook (translated)

Name: Word Perfect
Description:
Word building but only if your memory is in gear. All the tiles are face-down at the start. As players reveal the tiles you get to know the 'lie of the land' so to speak. Consonants and vowels are different colours. If you turn over a vowel tile you must announce the word you are trying to build.
Each word made scores points and the player at the end with the most points is the winner.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex Battlezone – Cityfight
Description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


User summary:
Codex Battlezone: Cityfight is an expansion codex book for Warhammer 40,000 3rd Edition. This codex covers battles in urban terrain with special rules, army list updates, equipment for fighting in cities, terrain modeling, campaign design and scenarios.

From the back cover:
Throughout the universe, warring races descend on each other's cities bringing destruction with them. In the shattered ruins, old generals are forced to learn new tricks while their soldiers hope merely to survive. Inside you will find:

Cityfight core rules explaining how to fight battles in urban terrain.

Codex modifications needed to amend army organization for Cityfight.

New equipment for attackers and defenders.

The Battle for Vogen. Background details for a famous cityfight in the Cadian Gate.

Cityscaping. Instructions on how to make your own buildings and assemble a Cityfight battlezone.

Gaming ideas. Advice on how to play campaign to decide the fate of a city.

ISBN: 1-84154-093-5

Name: Gamebook: An Interactive Book of Board Games
Description:
Gamebook is a hybrid, both an interactive book and a collection of board games. Gamebook contains eight abstract strategy board games, carefully selected from the rich gaming heritage that represents human history, our intelligence, wit, strategy and appetite for fun, play and socialising - all gathered in one uniquely designed interactive book, for you to see, to read and most importantly - to play.

It also has one new game, Be Humble, which is a racing game of four levels for two to six players. Each player has three figures of his own colour. The winner is the first to pass all their figures off the board. Be humble: if you progress too fast with one of your figures, the others will find it hard to follow.

Gamebook includes:
9 board games
1 booklet History & Rules (Eng/Slo)
72 figures, 6 two-sided sticks, 1 dice

Name: Be Humble
Description:
Be Humble is a racing game of four levels for two to six players. Each player has three figures of his own colour. The winner is the first to pass all their figures off the board. Be humble: if you progress too fast with one of your figures, the others will find it hard to follow.

It is part of Gamebook: An Interactive Book of Board Games.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Eye of Terror
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: PTG College Basketball
Description:
PTG College Basketball is an enjoyable full-play college basketball simulation game that offers some of the advanced gameplay that basketball aficionados will crave, while not sacrificing playability, so that it should appeal the more casual basketball fan, as well.

Shots are now taken as a 2-pt Rim, 2-pt Jumper, or 3-Pointer. The rim shot is taken within a couple of feet of the basket. Assists are now looked at through the player actually taking the shot. Rebounds are resolved with a single roll and take both players into account. Probably, the biggest change is the stamina system. We have moved to a per possession over a time clock method. Every player and team are taken into account in the game clock. 
Every player is rated from the season. That is over 5,000 players!

—description from the publisher

Name: Muffin Time: Kickstarter Pack
Description:
40 card expansion for Muffin Time.
Includes 11 holo cards.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Armageddon
Description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


User summary:
Codex: Armageddon is an expansion codex book for Warhammer 40,000 3rd Edition. The book details the planet of Armageddon and the epic battles which swept across it during the Third Armageddon War- one of the largest in the Imperium's history. The codex covers details of the planet and conflict as well as providing army lists for the forces involved. Notably This book also marks the appearance of the Ork Speed Freeks army list.

From the back cover:
Armageddon is a world torn apart by the largest Ork invasion in Imperial history. Inside you will find:

Four Army Lists: Four army list variants allow you to field a force of Ork Speed Freeks, Armageddon Steel Legion Imperial Guard, or Space Marines from the Black Templars and Salamanders Chapters.

Forces of Armageddon: A full-colour guide to the many forces battling for supremacy on Armageddon, as well as numerous examples of the ravaged battlefields being fought over.

The History of Armageddon: Full background and history of Armageddon, including detailed information on the mighty Ork horde of Warlord Ghazghkull and the Imperial forces opposing him.

ISBN: 1-84154-045-5

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Space Marines
Description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


User summary:
Codex: Space Marines is an expansion codex book for Warhammer 40,000 3rd Edition. This codex covers the most common Space Marine Chapters detailing history, equipment, organization, special rules and characters, painting schemes, and army lists.

From the back cover:
Space Marines are Humanity's ultimate warriors, dedicated to the defence of the Emperor and the Imperium of Man. Inside you will find:

Army Lists: The complete Space Marine army list, which allows you to choose your forces for a battle. Also included is information detailing all the weapons, vehicles and wargear used by Space Marines.

Hobby Section: Sixteen full colour pages packed with invaluable tips and advice on collecting, painting and playing with a Space Marine army.

Special Characters: Complete rules and background information for Space Marines characters such as Marneus Calgar, the Emperor's Champion, Captain Cortez and others.

New Scenario: Planetfall Mission - a new Space Marine mission scenario and rules for playing it.

ISBN: 1-869893-28-X

Re-print in 1999, 2001 and 2002.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Blood Angels
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Dark Angels
Description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


User summary:
Codex: Dark Angels is an expansion codex book for Warhammer 40,000 3rd Edition. This book covers the Dark Angels Chapter of the Space Marines and provides details of their history, chapter organization, equipment, special rules, painting schemes, and army lists.

From the back cover:
The stubborn warriors of the Dark Angels are held in awe throughout the galaxy, but have secretly pursued a sinister vendetta for ten thousand years. Inside you will find:

Army List: Rules and information for new forces available only to Dark Angels armies, such as the renowned Deathwing and Ravenwing. Also included is information detailing new weapons, vehicles, and wargear used by the Dark Angels.

New Scenario: A new Dark Angels mission and rules for playing it.

Hobby Section: Seven full colour pages packed with invaluable tips and advice on collecting, painting and playing with a Dark Angels army.

Special Characters: Rules and information for Dark Angels characters such as Commander Azrael, Chief Librarian Ezekiel and Interrogator Chaplain Asmodai.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Space Wolves
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Chaos Space Marines
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Craftworld Eldar
Description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


This edition is a 24 page saddle stapled book.

From the Table of Contents:
Introduction
Craftworld Army Lists
Iyanden Ghost Warriors
Saim-Hann Wild Riders
Craftworld Colours
Alitoc Ranger Force
Biel-Tan Swordwind Army
Ulthwe the Damned

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Dark Eldar
Description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


This edition is a 48 page soft bound book.

From the Table of Contents:

Introduction
Dark Eldar Army List
Choosing a Dark Eldar Army
Expanding Your Army
Dark Eldar Tactics
Dark Eldar Colour Schemes
Dark Eldar Markings
How to Pain t Dark Eldar
Painting Tips
Raider Colour Scheme
'Eavy Metal showcase
The Dark Eldar

Name: Flames of War: Bagration – Soviet Forces on the Eastern Front 1944
Description:
During the calm weeks leading up Operation Bagration, the Soviets had amassed their armies for the greatest offensive yet undertaken on the Eastern Front. Three years after the German invasion, the Red Army stands as battle-hardened troops, ready to finally push the fascist invaders out of Mother Russia! A screaming barrage of shells and rockets signals the beginning of Operation Bagration, and Soviet Rifle Corps charge forward to capture the fortress towns of Vitebsk, Orsha and Mogilov. The Red Army smashes through German Army Group Centre’s front line and then relentlessly advances westward across Byelorussia to threaten Minsk. The Red Army’s goes on the offensive all across the front, from Finland and Estonia in the north to Poland, Ukraine, Romania, and eventually across Hungary to lay siege to the city of Budapest.

—description from the publisher

Name: Flames of War: Soviet Starter Force – Heavy Assault Group
Description:
The Soviet 11th Guards Army (11ya Gvardeyskiy Armiya) and 31st Army (31ya Armiya) fell upon Orsha on 26 June 1944. 
A solitary Soviet tank brigade from the 2nd Tank Corps swept around to the west of the city, completing the encirclement. 
The German remnants of General Volkers' 27th Army Corps were now trapped inside the city and prepared for a tenacious defense of the city centre.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Tau
Description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


This version is a 64 page soft bound book.

From the Table of Contents.
Introduction
Overview of the Tau
A Tau'cyr among the Kroot
The Tau Way of War
Tau Battlesuit Technology
Wargear of the Tau
Tau Armoury
Tau Army List
Tau Summary
Painting & Collecting a Tau Army
Laeresh
Special Characters
Adeptus Palmatus
Tau Language
The Damocles Crusade
Bonding Ritual
Scenario: Hostage Situation
Tau Evolution
Tau Septs

Name: Flames of War: T-34 – Tank Battalion
Description:
The T-34 possesses an unprecedented combination of firepower, mobility, protection, and ruggedness. 
The T-34 is the mainstay of any Soviet army. 
Armed with an 85mm gun, the T-34 is able to go toe-to-toe with any German vehicle, and they are cheap enough that you can field an entire battalion out of them!

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Assassins
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Witch Hunters
Description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


User summary:

Codex: Witch Hunters is an expansion codex book for Warhammer 40,000 3rd Eition. It is one of three books either published or proposed about the Ordo Hereticus (Codex: Daemonhunters, Codex: Witch Hunters, Codex: Alienhunters).

From the back cover:

The Witch Hunters of the Ordo Hereticus are perhaps the most sinister of all Inquisitors as the threats they must face lurk not in the depths of space or the Warp, but amongst the everyday citizenry of the Imperium; the witch, the mutant, the heretic and the fallen cleric. Such abominations are an affront to the Emperor and together with their Chamber Militant, the Sisters of Battle, they purge evil from the worlds of Man with the cleansing fire of purity.

ISBN: 1-84154-485-X

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Daemonhunters
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Catachans
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Orks
Description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Tyranids
Description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


User summary:
Codex: Tyranids is an expansion codex book for Warhammer 40,000 3rd Edition. This codex covers the Tyranids race detailing their history, equipment, organization, special rules and powers, painting schemes, and army lists.

From the back cover:
The Tyranids are the most rapidly evolving race in the galaxy. They are super-predators destined to hunt all others to extinction. Inside you will find:

Army Lists: The complete Tyranid army list, which allows you to choose your forces for a tabletop battle. Also included are Tyranid Hive Mind powers, symbiote bio-weapons and biomorph enhancements for Tyranid creatures.

Hobby Section: Sixteen full colour pages packed with advice and tips on collecting, modelling and playing with a Tyranid army.

Genetic Modification: New rules for designing custom hive fleets, mutants and modifying Tyranid creatures to create unique species.

Special Monsters: Two infamous Tyranid creatures are described: Old One Eye and the Red Terror!

ISBN: 1-84154-013-7

Name: Windward: Treacherous Skies
Description:
The Windward: Treacherous Skies expansion adds many new elements to the game: a third level of elevation, scout boats for all players to use alongside their ships, world-building events, a pirate-style faction, contract mini-quests, team play, and more. All of these elements come together to open the door to countless new paths to victory.

-description from designer

Name: BattleCON: Big Box
Description:
This entry is for the Korean version of BattleCON which includes BattleCON: Devastation of Indines, BattleCON: Trials of Indines, BattleCON: Wanderers of Indines, and other promos packaged inside the box.

About the game:
BattleCON is a head-to-head battle card game that simulates the action and tactics of a one-on-one duel. Each player chooses one fighter from among a vast, diverse cast, and does battle against an opponent's fighter. 

Each fighter has their own selection of cards which are unique to them, as well as a pool of cards which are shared among all fighters. By linking their unique styles to the standardized bases, fighters can form original moves with many different interactions. 

Fighters also possess Unique Abilities (or UAs) which are new sub-systems that interact with their abilities. One fighter uses elemental stances, while another can charge powerful spells over time. One fighter sets up environment effects on the board, while another might control drones which attack at range.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave – Morgwaeth's Blade-coven
Description:
Morgwaeth the Bloodied and her murderous retinue were dispatched to Beastgrave by Morathi in search of a long-hidden shard of Khaine. Shadowed paths brought them to the mountain, and immediately they knew their objective was near – what else could account for the visions of slaughter and echoes of battle that haunted Beastgrave’s megalithic depths? In truth, however, their quest was a fool’s errand, for Morathi knew no shard lay in the mountain – Morgwaeth had questioned her liege a little too publicly, and was sent to Beastgrave for her temerity. This was a poor punishment for the hag queen, though – the blades of Khaine found many offerings to the lord of murder in the mountain’s ancient halls, and their dedication may yet see them escape Beastgrave’s grasp.

Can't choose between an objective-holding and combat-focused warband? With Morgwaeth’s Blade-coven on your side, you won't have to! A fast, aggressive and flexible Warhammer Underworlds warband, Morgwaeth’s Blade-coven possess a potent play style that rewards your careful positioning and mindfulness of objectives with all manner of slaughterous abilities – and buckets of glory. What’s more, this set features Universal cards for any warband in Warhammer Underworlds, while a free downloadable warscroll lets you fight with Morgwaeth’s Blade-coven in Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

This set contains:
- 5x push fit Morgwaeth's Blade-coven miniatures – no glue required to assemble
- 5x fighter cards, representing each warrior in your games – Morgwaeth The Bloodied, Kyrae, Khamyss, Kyrssa, and Lethyr
- A further 60 unique cards (only available in this set) to enhance your fighters and provide new tactics and challenges for your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave, including:
- 12x Morgwaeth's Blade-coven Objective cards
- 10x Morgwaeth's Blade-coven Upgrade cards
- 10x Morgwaeth's Blade-coven Ploy cards
- 9x Universal Objective cards, usable by any warband
- 18x Universal Power cards, usable by any warband

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave – Morgok's Krushas
Description:
Morgok and his mob of Ironjawz brutes once hunted down and fought the greatest prey they could find amongst Ghur’s trackless wastes. Whether they ran down spiny nephrodiles or fought the storm-warriors of Sigmar, Morgok’s Krushas sought the mightiest trophies in the name of their bellicose deity, Gorkamorka. While roaming a plain of ancient bones, the Ironjawz boss heard from afar the clash and clangour of battle. They pursued the sounds across the wilds until they arrived at Beastgrave – the noises were echoing from the mountain’s tunnels. Invigorated by Waaagh! energy that would only increase with each conflict, the brute boss led his cronies down into the caverns to win glory in the eyes of the great green god.

Waaagh! If you're looking for a Warhammer Underworlds warband that hits hard while being able to take a beating, you'll love Morgok’s Krushas. An excellent aggressive warband, Morgok’s Krushas control the pace of the game through their incredible durability and the new Waaagh! Counters game mechanic. What’s more, this set features Universal cards for any warband in Warhammer Underworlds, while a free downloadable warscroll lets you fight with Morgok’s Krushas in Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

This set contains:
- 3x push fit Morgok's Krushas miniatures – no glue required to assemble
- 3x fighter cards, representing each warrior in your games – Morgok, Thugg, and 'Ardskull
- A further 60 unique cards (only available in this set) to enhance your fighters and provide new tactics and challenges for your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave, including:
- 12x Morgok's Krushas Objective cards
- 10x Morgok's Krushas Upgrade cards
- 10x Morgok's Krushas Ploy cards
- 9x Universal Objective cards, usable by any warband
- 18x Universal Power cards, usable by any warband

Name: Himo Ōji to Niito Hime
Description:
The princess was hopelessly untidy. All her favourite things were lost in her messy room. She was a NEET with a bad personality and she got angry often. Although she was proposed many times, she refused to get married. One day the princess had an agreement with the king, her father, that should there be a prince who could find all her treasures scattered in her room, she would finally get married.

Kept Prince And NEET Princess is a Japanese Karuta style real-time dexterity tabletop game for 2-6 Players. It plays for around 10-20 mins. Roll the three dice, find the correct cards the fastest and collect enough cards to win the game. Make too many mistakes and you're out for good!

Name: End Times: Survive
Description:
Fulfill your essential needs or be the last player standing in this post-apocalyptic family board game!
     After the third world war, civilization is at its brink. You are among those last surviving people.
     Travel through the wasteland board in search of food and water, building supplies and plants. Build a rain water bucket to collect water, or build a garden to generate food.
     Be careful... if your water and food needs reach 0, you lose one health per turn. A health of zero means you perish!
     You may use building supplies to build a helicopter, or even a truck... or if you have anarchy in your heart... a Nuke!
     The Player with a complete 10 Waters, 10 Foods, and 10 Healths wins... or the last player standing!


—description from the designer

Name: Pyramid Po-Ke-No
Description:
Object- Score 500 points.

Each player gets a board with 10 poker hands listed. 2 decks of cards with jokers (which are wild for anything except a Royal Flush) are shuffled, and each player receives 7. Each turn, a player can play as few or as many cards as they wish, they may also discard as many cards as they like. Cards are played face down to the board- and once played, are not looked at until the end of the round. Player may then draw up to three cards (only from the deck, not the discard pile), with a 7 card maximum hand size.

Each space is dedicated to one specific poker category, and may be completed in one or more turns. Once a space is filled with the number of cards needed to make the listed hand, a chip is placed to mark that space as complete. Once all 10 hands on a board are completed, a player can call "full board", giving players 1 last turn each (discards may be reshuffled and made into a new draw deck as many times as there are players- the round ends immediately when a player can't draw cards, which is common with 3 or 4 players as a full board takes 40 cards to complete). The spaces are then checked. For each space, the player with the strongest completed hand scores the value of the space:

Any two cards (high card, no pair)- 3 points
One pair- 5 points
Two pair- 7 points
Three of a Kind- 8 points
Straight- 10 points
Flush- 15 points
Full House- 20 points
Four of a Kind- 30 points
Straight Flush- 40 points
Royal Flush- 60 points (must be natural- no jokers)

Ties in any space split the points rounded down. No score if the hand is incorrect or incomplete. The player who called "full board" scores 25 points if all 10 hands on their board are correct (even if some don't eventually score). If they called incorrectly, they lose 25 points. Play as many rounds as needed for someone to get 500 points.

Solitaire is played with one deck plus jokers- player gets 7 cards, plays exactly 3 at a time to spaces or discard, then draws 3. After going through the deck once or completing the board, player scores value of correctly completed hands plus 10 points for each card in hand or remaining in draw pile, minus 10 points for every card discarded.

Name: Ramparts (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
24 tiles with new city and road segments enrich the game.

No additional rules

Name: Galvanize!
Description:
Galvanize! is a fast, fun, and intense two-player competitive dice rolling flavored card game.
 In this game you play as one of two types of electric currents inside of a battery charger, where you race to charge the batteries more quickly and efficiently than your opponent.  Through the manipulation of double-sided tokens on the board, you create a continuous line of electric current that connects your source card with the batteries that you wish to charge. By successful charging of the batteries you get victory points. The player that reaches 15 victory points or charges all the batteries of his/her color as the first one wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Star Scrappers: Battledrill
Description:
Battledrill is a fast-paced skirmish miniature game set in the Star Scrappers Universe, where you take control of a crew of adventurers called Scrappers. These brave humans, unyielding robots and mysterious aliens are exploring the uncharted space of the Distant Edge in search of the ultimate prize - Hexis crystals - a power source that will change the image of space travel forever. In hostile places on primeval planets, where a lasergun in your holster is the only law, will you be the one who prevails and claims all the glory?

To play a game of Battedrill, you will need miniatures with their stat cards, dice, measure widgets (or a measure tape) and a table that will represent the battlefield of the skirmish between two opposing crews controlled by the players. Controlling your crew means performing available actions with your miniatures, such as moving, attacking or taking special actions. We have kept the rules simple and straightforward to provide dynamic battles, but also not to reduce the challenge and the tactical aspect of the game. Every model has a set of unique statistics and abilities, whose wise use is the key to victory.

Name: Legends of the Ancient World: Terrors of the Night
Description:
Terrors of the Night includes three programmed adventures using Dark City Games' Legends of the Ancient World rule set. These rules provide gameplay very similar to that of Melee and Wizard from Metagaming. This adventure is compatible with those games as well.

Battles are fought with counters on a hex map that is included with the game.

—user summary

There is a new evil in Redpoint. Citizens disappear at an alarming rate. Every day, people from all walks of life report their missing loved ones, and the town watch suspects that they are being abducted. The watch has evidence to indict a notorious wizard of ill repute, but the watch lacks the resources to bring him in. This is where you come in...

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Legends of the Ancient World (Dark City Games)

Name: River System (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
Expansion to the river expansions. Additionally there is a tile to include the lake landscape.

This expansion contains 11 tiles.

No additional rules.

Name: Privateer
Description:
Skirmish miniatures rules during the Golden Age of Piracy.

Includes rules for individual model temperaments, scenarios, ship-board actions, and some slight role playing.  Works on an action-point system.

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Command Edition
Description:
Start playing Warhammer 40,000 with the Command Edition – a set designed to give you a comprehensive start with the world’s best sci-fi wargame. With models, rules, guides to help you begin and much more, this massive set takes the hassle out of kicking off your hobby – build your models, learn to play and have hours of fun with a friend or family member right out of the box.

This set contains:

- 27 push fit plastic miniatures, only requiring clippers to assemble (we recommend Citadel Starter Set Clippers or Citadel Fine Detail Cutters – not included) – no glue, no mess – including:

- 1x Overlord: An imperious commander of the Necron phalanxes, the Overlord’s authority is absolute. The model comes supplied with a Citadel 40mm Round Base.
- 10x Necron Warriors: The mainstay of the Necron phalanxes, these bipedal warriors obliterate their prey with relentless volleys of atomising gauss weaponry. Each model comes supplied with a Citadel 32mm Round Base and a choice of heads and weapons.
- 3x Canoptek Scarab Swarms: Flying hordes of these insectile machines chew through armour, flesh and bone with impunity. Each swarm comes supplied with a Citadel 40mm Round Base.
- 3x Skorpekh Destroyers: Swift and deadly hunters, Skorpekh Destroyers chase down their prey to carve them apart with their fearsome reaping blades. Each model comes supplied with a Citadel 50mm Round Base.
- 1x Canoptek Plasmacyte: A cruel and calculating manipulator of tainted energy, the Plasmacyte is capable of sending its Destroyer kin into a killing frenzy. The model comes supplied with a Citadel 28mm Round Base.
- 1x Primaris Captain: A superlative commander and highly skilled warrior, a Primaris Captain is the commander of an entire company of his battle-brothers. The model comes supplied with a Citadel 40mm Round Base.
- 5x Assault Intercessors: This squad of aggressive combatants tear their enemies apart in melee with reaping swings of their grinding chainswords. Each model comes supplied with a Citadel 32mm Round Base.
- 3x Outriders: Take the fight to the enemy flanks from the back of armoured bikes with these far-ranging reconnaissance riders. Each model comes supplied with a Citadel 90mm Oval Base.

- The Warhammer 40,000: Command Manual – Your guide to battle in the 41st Millennium. It contains an overview of the Warhammer hobby, in-depth background for your new models, and a step-by-step guide to building and battling with your forces, including all the rules you need for your first games.

- A 30" by 22.4" gaming board – Transform any kitchen table into an appropriately grim, dark warscape! The gaming board also displays several lettered markers designed to work alongside the missions in the Command Manual.

- Push fit plastic terrain designed to bring your tabletop to life, featuring a mixture of pipes and gothic ruins.

- Range rulers and dice – These essential accessories cover you for movement, shooting, close combat and more.

- Datasheets provide you with rules for all the models in the set, plus a set of expansion options for when you want to branch out with new kits.

- A Space Marines Transfer Sheet with over 600 transfers, designed to make adding Chapter-specific details, squad insignia, kill markings, and more simple – perfect for when you want to finish off your painted models!

- Warhammer 40,000: The Rules softback book, your complete guide to the Warhammer 40,000 tabletop wargame. Taking all the rules content from the Core Book (available separately), this book is ideal for when you're ready to expand your army and battle other players, including options for narrative, matched and open play, loads of missions to get stuck into, and more!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Colour Run
Description:
A competitive, family-fun card game incorporating both luck and strategy. Players organise their colour-based cards to create three speciï¬c runs of colour, ï¬‚ipping over a corresponding token as they do so.

Be the first player to flip over all three tokens, or create the elusive 'Ultimate Colour Run' to instantly win the game!

Special cards add to the action. The 'Rainbow' card acts as a wildcard, while 'Void' cards force players to discard cards. The sought after 'Absorb' card lets players swap a card with another player.

—description from the designer

Name: Times Table Heroes
Description: Master times table from 1 to 12 with these games. Practice 2, 5 and 10 times tables with Multiplication Bingo, or flip over the board to play Times Table Heroes. Save the city by solving multiplication sums, overcoming disasters with your unique superhero powers, and be the first to defeat the evil robot.

Name: Arena World
Description:
Ever since its discovery, magic has been a source of conflict accross the Realm. Over time, factions have used it to tame the elements of their land, repel invaders and conquer enemies. When war finally erupted, the world was plunged into darkness for decades. Peace seemed unattainable until leaders agreed on the foundation of the Magic Council, a committee in charge of legislating the use of magic across the Realm and prohibiting it during warfare.
To elect members of the Council, a representative of each faction was sent as their champion to compete in a tournament called Arena. In this tournament, champions used all their magic powers to battle each other in an epic clash. The winner claimed the throne of the Magic Council, while the others were assigned a title proportional to their performance. Arena became a tradition and remains to this day how members of the council are elected every year.

Tales of Arena is a 3-round arena skirmish game. It can be played by 3 to 4 players.
To start the game, each player is assigned a champion and a map is set in the arena. Each round starts with a market phase where players provide their champion with gear. Then, players unleash their champion’s magic powers to defeat each other during the arena phase. Fortunately, champions can not die in the arena. When they are drained (0HP), they are removed momentarily but come back their next turn by their starting gate. This is made possible by the soul pool, a device that can exchange souls to save champions. It has a finite number of souls though, so when it is emptied, the round ends and Victory Points are given to each player. A new map is then set, and players can further equip their champion during the following market phase. After three rounds, the player with the most Victory Points wins the game, and as such their champion wins the throne of the Magic Council!

Name: Agents: Sword and Shield – Big Game
Description: Agents Sword and Shield: Big Game is a first expansion to the Zvezda's game Agents Sword and Shield. This expansion adds 2 new factions: the German Stasi and the PRC MGB. Thus, up to six players can now take part in the game. In the expansion there is a new mechanic of the revolution that can occur in third world countries. Revolutions provide players with the ability to make new tactical decisions in the game. Also, the expansion include a new type of agent - influence agent, which allows a draw in favor of a player who has such an agent in the region.

Name: Smirkle: the saracastic "sorry about that" dice game
Description: Smirkle is a dice game that is as fun as chasing chickens. The points add up fast and the risk is very high. Shoot you might as well get the pickup or risk it for a biscuit. You always start with the smirkle dice and then roll the 8-sided dice. Get three of a kind and other combinations to win quickly.

Name: Chachapoya: SNAKE Adventurer Promo Cards
Description:
The base Chachapoya game is expanded by 3 new different adventurer cards. We shuffle the SNAKE Adventurer promo cards into the adventurer's deck, then prepare the other cards as its written in the game rules.

THE TORCH: The player leading The Torch card can check the hidden treasure card but he cannot show it to the other players!

THE MAP: The player leading The Map card can switch the hidden treasure to the bottom treasure card in the drawing deck.

THE COMPASS: The player leading The Compass turns over the hidden treasure card to show it to all of the players.
In other cases follow the original game rules.

Enjoy playing the game and have fun with treasure hunting!

-description from designer

Name: Circus Break
Description:
Circus Break is a fast-paced card flipping game, which involves players competing with each other, in order to obtain a key to escape from the circus that is run by a horrible owner.

Each player receives a unique character at the start of the game, which needs to be hidden until you wish to use the characters' abilities.
You will need to identify turned-over cards and use them wisely to process the game, read more cards, obstruct others etc. , and eventually be the first to escape the circus by using the key.

Our game contains different character abilities, varieties of action cards, random game-changing events. This will create countless situations and make our gameplay more exciting and fascinating.

—description from the designer

Name: Any Emotion
Description:
A game to learn to distinguish and know the primary emotions.
Includes several game modes.

Game mode: EmoVeloz
Objective of the game:
Get the highest number of cards at the end of the game.

Game preparation:
All the cards are shuffled and stacked face down. A player takes a card and separates it from the rest and indicates what data must be located as indicated by the rocket pencil on the back of the removed card.
How to play:
When all the players are ready, one player turns over the top card of the deck. All players at the same time and without touching the card will have to search for the data. The first to say it out loud and cover the letter will get the letter set aside as a point.
The letter that was face up is left to one side, but in this case face down in order to see what the rocket pencil indicates.
The data to look for in the charts are the following:
 Red (number): the emotion that is repeated the number of times indicated by the card (joy, sadness, surprise or anger)
Purple (sex): the largest group represented on the card (boy-girl). In the event of a tie, “tie” must be indicated.
Blue (hair): it will be necessary to discover which hair color is the most numerous in the group of boys and girls on the chart.

When there is only one letter left, it will be turned over to check what data to look for (what the rocket pencil marks). When everyone is ready, it is turned around again and the players try to be the fastest to discover the data.

Game over:
When the deck of cards is finished the players will count the cards obtained. The participant who has collected the most cards will be the winner. In case of a tie, all are winners! Shall we play another?
RECOMMENDATIONS: It is highly advisable to play the first few times with a single data to search, that is, it is always the same data for the entire game. You can start looking in the cards for hair color, the next game look for the majority in sex and in the third look for the coincidence in the number of repetitions of the same emotion that indicates the back of the card.

Un juego para conocer y reconocer las principales emociones con diversos modos de juego

Name: Eysenhudt: Adaptives Kampf System
Description:
The Adaptive Combat System is a Mini Expansion for Eysenhudt to make battle more adaptive and thus more challenging. The basic thought behind the Adaptive Combat System is: the more power in arms your army – the »Heller Haufen« – is  able  to  mass,  the  more  aware  the  targets’  defenders  will  become  of your armaments. So they will most likely adapt!
Thus battle against the important fortified towns will become more challenging than ever (and regardless of your actual attack's potential). After you have computed your strength you determine the difficulty-level against which to compete with the help of a rotary dial and a dice roll. Each difficulty-level (the basic copper ~, the silver ~, the gold ~, the palladium ~ and the plutonium level) comes with its own set of Battle Cards and with its own die. So, in the hardest case you've to compete against a D16 with a lessened probability of rolling the lower values (but also, of course, of rolling a total failure). Thus, with increased difficulty the luck-factor (or bad-dice-roll-factor) decreases.
This Mini Expansion is meant to be optional and for all who want to try a new challenge when going into battle.

—description from the designer

Name: My Date with a Zombie
Description:
You task is to get your Zombie ready for their date by finding their lost pieces (Head, Body, Arms, Legs) and when possible getting a bonus item to make the date extra special (Flowers, Golf Clubs, Climbing Rope, etc).  This is done by drawing from a deck of cards with a variety of zombie parts associated with a variety of dates.

Each round you choose from a variety of actions (place, swap, draw, trade, bid or start over) in an effort to build the best date you can.  Points are awarded based on the success of getting ready for your date, the bonus items and how carefully you manage your bidding.  The player with the highest score after the agreed upon number of rounds wins the game.

With a wonderful balance of strategy and luck, this fun and quirky game if suited for 2-6 players and generally plays in 15-45 minutes depending on how many rounds you choose to play.

-description from designer
